fields.description:
Hi,

 

Is there any way to customize the screen that shows the list of tickets raised by the reporter in Customer portal.

 

Can we add more columns to the screen or not.

 

Regards,

Atish Chaudhary
fields.summary: customize customer portal in jira service desk

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no option for administrator to export SLA configuration data including the goals settings if they would like to have the same configuration for other projects. The administrator need to copy is manually.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to export the SLA configuration data and import it to a different project. 

h3. Why this is important
It's easier for the administrator to use the same configuration for a different project.

h3. Workaround 
Copy the configuration manually.
fields.summary: Allow to export SLA configuration and import it to a different project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Detail missed in the title for brevity: the SLA metric must also have a 'pause'/'unpause' condition triggered at the same time as or very close to the close of the SLA.

Occurrences mostly happen when there is an Automation rule running on resolution of an issue (eg: adding a "your request has been closed" comment) after closing an issue that had a paused SLA. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Very rare, not practical to reproduce manually. This just outlines an example config that matches the prerequisites to reproduce.
 # Ensure there is an SLA metric which pauses on "Status: Waiting for Agent" and stops on "Resolution set"
 # Ensure there is an automation rule which comments on resolution of a request. 
 # Create a request
 # Put the request in status "Waiting for agent" 
 # Resolve the request (with any status that is not "Waiting for agent")

h3. Expected Results

 The SLA referred to in step 1 should be closed and commented on as specified by the automation rule in step 2.
h3. Actual Results

The comment works, but the SLA will sometimes (rarely) be unpaused and still running. 
h3. Known Workarounds
 * Remove pause conditions from SLA metrics which stop on the same trigger which any automation rule uses to update the issue at all (comment, edit, transition)
 * Remove automation rules which update the issue at all from issues which have pause conditions.   

h3. Extra Details:

This may theoretically also occur in slight variations of example mentioned setup.
fields.summary: Issue updates soon after SLA stop can cause incorrect SLA state

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It would be helpful if JIRA only shows a User picker at customer portal for logged in users. In case you set up a customer portal [login-free|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/04/introducing-the-login-free-portal-for-jira-service-desk-cloud] and under your project settings you allow your customers to search their organization for approvers, even users that do not have an account yet could see my customers emails while submitting a request while searching on a user picker.

I would like to have the option to only allow users logged in to search on User Picker fields. So far you can only enable or disable this option for all the users.
fields.summary: Add the Ability to only show a User picker for logged in users at Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , in the latest changes in JSD Automation, administrator is not allow to add multiple trigger. In the previous design , administrator is allowed to do so. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It is best to allow back creating multiple triggers in automation.

h3. Why this is important
The previous administrator already use to create multiple trigger.

h3. Workaround 
Create multiple automation for each trigger.
fields.summary: Allow to add multiple trigger in Automation

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

The *Jira Service Desk* JQL is not capable of tracking which specific user/group was assigned to the ticket when the SLA for "Time to First Response" and "Time to Resolution" starts ticking and all the way to it meeting the SLA or breaching the SLA. The report only takes in consideration of the final value of the SLA and tabulates that to the JQL. 

h3. *Sample Scenario* 

If there are two assignee and the ticket has met it's SLA when the first assignee worked on it, and after that the the second assignee was assigned to work on this issue and closes it. It is currently not possible, to generate a report to show who was assigned when the ticket met/breached the SLA. 

The JQL is only capable of generating on who was assigned to this ticket and what was the SLA status, in which the report will show both the users. 

h3. *Why This is Important*

For users who are calculating performance of the users and require multiple users to be working on an issue, with the advance JQL it would be very helpful to determine which user was actually responsible for the SLA meeting and failing during the duration of the issue being open. 

As of now, it is only possible to manually check on which user was assigned to the ticket and met the SLA goals based on the *Issue History*
fields.summary: The Ability To Tabulate Data on User Assigned During a SLA is met/breached in Jira Service Desk Report

fields.description:
The ability to fully customize the customer portal is very important to us, and we would imagine to all Service Desk admins. Therefore, here are some specifics I would offer up front:

- The Customer Portal must work well on all mobile devices and all images (including background and banner images) must resize properly to fit the screen size of the device.
- Cloud admins such as myself need to be able to edit all texts, including complete removal of a text without the need to resort to workarounds. (All editable text should be optional.)
- Backgrounds must be 100% in the control of the Cloud admin, including removal of the background if desired.
- Custom CSS must be allowed.
- Text color must not be tied to a theme, as is with the current portal, as this leads to situations where potentially the text is invisible, or hard to see (depending on the background color). Again, all color schemes and CSS must be in the control of the admin.
fields.summary: Improvements on the new customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers are occasionally unable to create new requests by sending an email. The audit log reports the error message as: "You don't have permission to access this Service Desk".
h3. Steps to Reproduce

So far, only reproducible on instances reporting the issue.
h3. Expected Results

The service desk creates the new request from the email as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The email is given a "Failure" status in the email processing logs (on page https://<hostname>/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa ) with the error message: "You don't have permission to access this Service Desk".

No request is created. 
h3. Known Workarounds

If the email which was processed incorrectly was sent to a custom email channel:
 * Mark the email as "unread" to trigger re-processing by JSD. Most of the time it will be processed correctly on the second attempt
fields.summary: Customer emails intermittently rejected with incorrect "You don't have permission to access this Service Desk" Error

fields.description:
Hi support,

 

We have 2 different account in Atlassian cloud and we would like to join all the service in one domain.

 

The first instance we have: BitBucket, Jira, Confluence and some plugins

The second one we have: Service Desk and Confluence.

 

The both domains are under the same company and the same type of billing account. 

 

Could you help us to join all in one?
fields.summary: Join 2 domains in one

fields.description:
Currently, the Customer Portal focuses automatically to the first field where customers need to type, so if the request type has a description and the customer uses a screen reader, it does not read this field and the customer must use Tab to read all the fields.
Also, as mentioned on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67535, if the customer tries to create a field without filling all required fields, Jira does not warn what is the field, making customers to use Tab and listen to all fields again to review and try to find where the didn't add information.

It would be great if Jira has an option in the JSD (project level) to enable accessibility for a specific customer portal, so the focus could be added to the first field, even though the field is a description (text only).
fields.summary: Accessibility - Option to enable accessibility to Customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing the Jira language, under the profile, the "Organization" and "Request participants" fields does not translate.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to profile and change the Jira language;
# Go to any issue and check the Organization and Request Participant fields;
* Spanish: 
 !Spanish.png|thumbnail! 
* French:
 !French.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results

The "Organization" and "Request participants" fields follow the chosen language.

h3. Actual result

The "Organization" and "Request participants" fields still in English.

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Changing the Jira language to any other does not translate the "Organization" and "Request participants" fields

fields.description:
*Summary*

When a new Service Desk Project is created, only the "Queue page" JQL follows the language format of the profile of the person who creates the Service Desk Project. This causes the queue to not load at all.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Set the *System Configuration* language to English.
 # Set your profile language to Dansk, Italiano (any other language except English) 
 # Create a new Service Desk Project 
 # When the project is successfully created check the *SLA* page (it will be in English as per the system configuration)
 # If you open the *Queue* tab in the same Service Desk Project, it will be in your profile language such as Dansk, Italiano(any other language that you have set) 
 # Try to click on a few of the default queue, it will load indefinitely .
 

*Sample Outcome:*
  *SLA Page (System Language Setting: English Language) :*

 
 - Time to Resolution

 - Time to First Response

 

 *Queue P**age (Profile Language Setting: Deutsch Language) :*

 
 *All Open Queue (How it is):*
{code:java}
resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY "Dauer bis zur Lösung" ASC {code}
 

*All Open Queue (How it is supposed to be):*

 
{code:java}
 resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY "Time to Resolution" ASC {code}
 

*Expected Results*

The entire Service Desk Project should follow one language setting which is the system language setting.

*Actual Results*

Instead the Queue page follows the user who creates the project language profile setting. 

 

*Workaround:*

*Quick Fix:* 
 # Among the list of queues that load infinitely, find one which can be loaded properly without the circling loop
 # Click on the (...) button > Click on Edit Queue
 # Now Click on the queue which loads infinitely, refresh the page, you will now be able to click on (...) button > Click on Edit Queue 

*Note: The above doesn't work always, if the quick fix fails please go to the second workaround below.*

*Queue Loading Fix:*
 # Add the profile language translation of the SLA in the SLA page 
 # Please *contact customer support*, to retrieve profile language translation for the default SLA name for any language.  
 # By adding the profile language translation in the SLA page, the Queue page will now follow the newly added SLA and start loading properly. 
 # You can now edit the queue with the correct language based on the SLA page. 

 

*New Service Desk Project Fix*

Until the bug is fixed, please ensure when you create a new Service Desk Project, that your profile language and system configuration language is the same, to avoid the Queue being created with the incorrect language.
fields.summary: Queue's JQL Translation follows Service Desk Project Creator's Profile Language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently approvers can be configured to have default values or user input. However, by allowing user input would allow the user to select themselves as the approver.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow restricting reporters selecting themselves as approvers.
h3. Why this is important
In some cases, having the reporter themselves to approve their request is not ideal and but configuring a preset approver is not wanted as the approvers could differ.
fields.summary: Restrict reporter from choosing themselves as approver

fields.description: Currently, it's not possible to change the notification settings to not receive SLA breached notifications on iOS app.
fields.summary: As a Jira Mobile User, I would like to change the notification settings to not receive SLA breached notifications.

fields.description:
h3. The issue
When an instance has more than one Service Desk projects implemented, if a customer access the portals, all Request Type's descriptions are displayed. Although, if one of the Request Types does not have a description, a default "No Description" text is displayed.

h3. The suggestion
Change the default "No Description" to nothing, keeping the portal cleaner for Request Type's names that are self-explanatory.
fields.summary: Hide description when there is none for a Service Desk Project
Unable to find Payments-OnCall Jira project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After adding a rule with a  "Send email"  action, user cannot edit translations in *Language Support* page.

The UI in language support page will display:

!Screen Shot 2018-06-19 at 2.57.51 PM.png|width=308,height=98!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Automation* page and create a rule with "Send email" action
 # Go to *Language Support* page to edit translations 

h3. Expected Results

User can edit translation.
h3. Actual Results 

User receives "Could not find lingo for rule" error message.
h3. Workaround

 There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Cannot edit translation in Language Support after adding a send notification rule

fields.description:
h3. Description

It would be nice to have the ability to stylish the Satisfaction Survey text. We could have a WYSIWYG editor to customize the survey question.
fields.summary: Add the ability to Style the Customer Satisfaction

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The KB article creation will fail if an issue key is mentioned in the Issue Description.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Raise a ticket in a JIRA Service Desk Project that has a knowledge base linked to it.
 # Edit the Issue Description and add another issue's key coming from the current Jira instance: KEY-123 (not the issue URL) - this will get rendered as an enhance issue link.
 # Click on "Create Article"

h3. Expected Results

You'll be redirected to Confluence to create the KB article.
h3. Actual Results

The following error will display on JIRA.
{noformat}
 We're having trouble communicating with the application. Wait a minute, then try again. {noformat}
h3. Workaround

You may replace the Issue Key with the issue URL.
fields.summary: Unable to create KB article from JIRA issue when the issue description contains a simple issue key (getting rendered as a referenced issue within the Jira instance)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira Service Desk allows users to turn off the notification of a specific ticket. Due to this action, the user may miss out some important updates.

Portal:
 !screenshot1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow admin to decide whether to enable/disable this option for each project.
h3. Why this is important
 * In some cases, the company uses Jira Service Desk to support the internal users (employees). Thus, the management would like the employee to receive the notifications at all time.
fields.summary: Ability to disable "Don't notify me" option from the Portal and email

fields.description: Currently, we have no way to tell who created a Customer Organization in Jira Service Desk. It would be of great help if there could be this possibility, even if it is through the Audit Logs themselves.
fields.summary: Provide Audit Logs for Customer Organization Creation

fields.description:
Requests created through the JSD Widget could capture "context" or user information automatically, such as the page the widget was called from and other browser information.

JSDCLOUD-5778 is somewhat related, in that Javascript could potentially be used to provide more site-specific context.
fields.summary: Capture "Context" (url, ...) with the widget requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the user who should run the automation is deactivated before the automation run, Jira does not log any information about the error.

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk Automation.

h3.Steps to reproduce
* 1. Go to automation;
* 2. Create a "Closed resolved issues" automation;
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-12 at 17.01.20.png|thumbnail! 
* 3. Create an issue, then resolve it;
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-12 at 17.01.04.png|thumbnail!  
* 4. Deactivate the user, before running the automation;
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-12 at 16.58.27.png|thumbnail! 
* 5. View automation log and the error "User null does not have permission to execute the rule" is shown.

h3. Expected results

Jira should keep which user does not have permission and which issue could not be executed.

h3. Actual result

Jira does not show the user and the issue that didn't execute.
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-12 at 17.01.14.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Automation rule won’t log actions by deleted users

fields.description:
When the service desk portal link is shared with customers they are not able to have a clear view of requests raised by them. We require few additional features where.

-Customer can *Sort* the ticket.

-*Filter* the tickets status wise.

-An *Export to Excel* option where all the tickets could be exported with or without any filters.
fields.summary: Need Sort, Filter and Export to excel Option on customer's portal

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
At the moment, JIRA Service Desk only supports converting portal-only customers to Atlassian Accounts manually and it is not possible to bulk convert application portal-only customers to users.

h2. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to bulk convert JSD portal-only customer to users.

h2. Why this is important

To enhance the admin experience, allowing them to have better control over their customers and users, and also help them to save a lot of time when they decide to convert their customers to users.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to bulk convert application portal-only customers to users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the *Front Page Title* on Help Center view and customize does not accept empty.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the "Front Page Title" to accept empty.
fields.summary: Allow the "Front Page Title" to accept empty

fields.description:
Hi,

While in a support ticket in Jira support desk, I am unable to use the browser its back button.
I expect the back button to bring me back to the ticket overview page but instead it just stays in the current view of the support ticket.

Would love to see this change.

Kind regards,

Ian van Gorkum
fields.summary: Back button in Jira supportdesk tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In [Resolving permission scheme errors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/resolving-permission-scheme-errors-838416389.html#Resolvingpermissionschemeerrors-major] documentation explain about major and minor issue when changing the JIRA Service Desk default permission scheme. However , it's not stated about "Delete Issue" permission and admin is receiving warning when edit the "Delete Issue" permission. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# To check the warning , just update the "Delete Issue" permission.
# Check in the documentation , no information about it

h3. Expected Results
There's information about "Delete Issue" permission whether it is a major or minor issue.

h3. Actual Results
There's no information about it.
fields.summary: Documentation is not updated with "Delete Issue" permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the *Help Center name* allows 30 characters, and with companies that have large names that this is an issue.
h3. Suggested Solution

Increase the field size to allow more than 30 characters.
h3. Workaround

Abbreviating the company name (like LTD., CORP., INC., etc.).
fields.summary: Increase Help Center name size to allow more than 30 characters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIR Service Desk project doesn't allow an administrator to edit the default permission scheme, based on [Resolving permission scheme errors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/resolving-permission-scheme-errors-838416389.html#Resolvingpermissionschemeerrors-major]. However, went an administrator make the changes, the warning will display to all another project administrator (if they have multiple administrators). This will make confusion to the administrators.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be better if it only give warning to the person that make the changes.

h3. Why this is important
This will make sure there's no confusion between the administrators.
fields.summary: Permission scheme verification warning should be displayed only once to administrator that make the changes

I want to create a custom list type field with values dependent on another custom list field. Example I have a list field 'Country' and I select 'Norway' and I want another custom field say 'State'  listing only states in 'Norway'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. 
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Text copied from MS Powerpoint get converted into an image when pasted In JSD

h3. Environment
* Chrome Version 66.0.3359.181 (Official Build) (64-bit) (MAC)
* Safari Version 11.1 (13605.1.33.1.4) (MAC)
* Jira Service Desk Application 3.3.0-OD-1000.3857.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Chrome > access your instance
# Have a JSD project running (with description and attachment fields available)
# Open Powerpoint > Create a presentation or open default ones provided > Copy some text from the presentation
# Open Customer Portal > Go to create a new request
# Paste this table in the description field

h3. Expected Results
- JIRA should paste the text within the description field.

h3. Actual Results
- JIRA is attaching the text as an attachment (image).
 
h3.Workaround
Copy the text from Powerpoint, paste it first into a simple text editor like notepad and then copy it again from the text editor and paste into JSD comments box.
fields.summary: Text copied from MS Powerpoint Get Converted into an Image When Pasted In JSD

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who are using Jira Service Desk Automation for reminders in their Service Desk Projects would like the Automation to be run as a Generic User rather than the Project Default or the User who triggered the Action

h3. Suggested Solution
Include a Generic User in Jira Service Desk that Automation can be run as rather

h3. Why this is important
Some of the Automations that can be configured, like an SLA Alert, should be sent out as a "System Event" or with a Generic User Account so that the Issue History does not imply that a User performed the Action
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Include a Generic Account for Automation Actions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a project with Danish default and indexing language, the queues cannot be loaded due to the queues has a default SLA *Tid til beslutning* (Time to resolution) with a trailing white space. eg: {{resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY "Tid til beslutning " ASC}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the default and indexing language to Danish in the General Configuration 
# Create a Service Desk project
# Access the queues

h3. Expected Results
Queue is loaded
h3. Actual Results
Queue is not loaded and shows an infinite loop

h3.Workaround
Manually edit the queues to remove the trailing white space for the *Tid til beslutning* SLA field. Please contact support to do this.
fields.summary: Creating a project in Danish language causes default queues to not load

fields.description:
*Summary*
When using Internet Explorer 11 and accessing https://kacocdb.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/create/1 the Create button doesn't work if a required field is not filled in the first attempt to create the ticket.

*Environment*
Internet Explorer 11

*Steps to Reproduce*
Access https://kacocdb.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/create/1 ;
Leave one required field empty (e-mail, for example);
The system gives a warning telling that the field is required;
Enter the information;
Click on "Create" button;

*Expected Results*
A message saying that the ticket was created.

*Actual Results*
Nothing happens

*Workaround*
Use a different browser such as
* Google Chrome
* Firefox
* Safari
fields.summary: Create button doesn't work if a required field is not filled in the first attempt to create a ticket.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the Knowledge Base settings screen, when trying to set up a link with a Confluence space to set up the KB integration, it fails with the following message: _We're having trouble communicating with the application. Wait a minute, then try again._

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Knowledge Base settings of a service desk project
# Start to link a KB space to JSD
# After selecting the System application link with Confluence the error message shows up

h3. Expected results 

The flow should enable to pick the space and save the KB link.

h3. Actual result

The flow is stopped and the KB linking can not be done.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: JSD Cloud to Confluence Cloud knowledge base space linking doesn't work

fields.description:
Hi,

Created new user sanjai.k  with emaild [sanjai.k@landmarkwebteam.com .|https://landmark.atlassian.net/admin/users/view?username=sanjai.k]

But user is not receiving any emails in from Jira ,I tried to resend password link several times and its not reaching the email id .

Help us to verify whether Jira is blocking emails to [landmarkwebteam.com|https://landmark.atlassian.net/admin/users/view?username=sanjai.k] domain.

 

Thanks

Pratheesh
fields.summary: Invitation mail is not reaching users email account

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a Confluence space is linked as knowledge base to JIRA Service Desk, when the agents open the tickets in JSD queue, it through below error in the issue view screen under *Related knowledge base articles* section.
{quote}
We're having trouble communicating with the application. Wait a minute, then try again.
{quote} 
h3. Customer Impact
Agents are not able to check the related knowledge base article to the tickets raised through JSD portal and in JSD project directly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Raise a ticket in one of the Jira Service Desk Projects which has knowledge base linked to one of their Confluence spaces.
# Create a ticket in the service desk project either through customer portal or directly in the JSD project.
# Open the ticket as the agent from JSD queue or full view mode.

h3. Expected Results
JSD should pull all the *Related knowledge base articles* from the linked Confluence knowledge base.

h3. Actual Results
JSD is failing to connect to Confluence space and pull the articles.
{noformat}
We're having trouble communicating with the application. Wait a minute, then try again.
{noformat}

h3. Additional info
Customer can search articles in the customer portal, but they can't access them. Clicking on a search result will just send back to the "Knowledge Base Home".

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Issues Accessing to KB article through the Service Desk

fields.description:
I started JSD trial on my prod instance (templates.atlassian.com). I clicked the try button in app switcher, clicked through the first few dialogs, clicked on create project and landed on a blank page:

!image-2018-06-04-11-57-16-160.png|width=657,height=419!
fields.summary: After starting trial with Try JSD in the app switcher, landed to an blank page

fields.description:
The ability to expose/execute specific catalog items within the portal based on normal security permissions (like currently exist via permission schemes).

 

Issue:

Without the ability to expose only certain catalog items, you have to maintain two separate projects to get a simple feature.  This doubles the about of work, setup, customization and extremely complicates logical workflows.
fields.summary: Portal request type group permissions

fields.description: My attack command is not working properly.
fields.summary: attack command is not working

fields.description:
It would be great to see the request type icon next to the label in the queues, is that possible?

Thanks
fields.summary: Display request type icon in queue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to access the Queue page, this error is shown:
!screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Customer Impact
Agents unable to view the Queue to work on the issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any SD project
# Access Queue page

h3. Expected Results
The list of tickets are showing under the queue

h3. Actual Results
Error message is shown.
!screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Use filters to work on the issues
fields.summary: Something has gone wrong" on Queue page

fields.description: We have some customers want to see more info about their requests in the list view. When they view their requests they want to be able to sort their requests by priority. Can we configure it in portal view?
fields.summary: We need more columns and ways to order request in portal view.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Approve and Decline buttons are visible on the issue even request is not on an Approval status

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Service Desk Project
# Configure Approval to the Status 2
# Add approval field to the request type
# Create a request, add an approval

h3. Expected Results
As request is on the Status 1, there shouldn't be Approve/Decline buttons

h3. Actual Results
Approver can see the request and Approve/Decline buttons on it
fields.summary: Approval buttons appear on the Portal on the non -approval statuses

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When linking a Confluence space to a Service Desk project's Knowledge Database, the URL of the link may be wrong.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access any Service Desk Project;
# Click *Knowledge base*;
# Select *Link to a Confluence Space* and proceed to configure the link.

h3. Expected results 

The link should have the right URL for the Confluence Space.

 !BJ Sites.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

Eventually, the URL might contain unwanted caracters (in this example, the link was being created with /wiki/wiki/).

 !LTW.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Contact your friendly neighbors Support Engineers @ https://support.atlassian.com/
fields.summary: Knowledge base / KB settings screen renders with double/added "wiki" in the Confluence space url (KB feature working fine)

fields.description:
In JIRA Service Desk when an agent is assigned to a Request Type, they are notified when an issue is created via the portal and assigned the issue automatically.

When setting up automation for key words, the key words are picked up and the custom request type is set however, the assignee is not set.

 

How to replicate:
 # Create a request type
 # Set the assignee to a Service Desk agent
 # Create automation to look for keywords and assign a Request Type based on these keywords.
 # Request type is set, the assignee is not.
fields.summary: Automation ignores assignee for request type JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The organization field when printing an issue is empty even when it contains an organization.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an organization to the Organizations field. 
# Go to Export 
# Select Print. 


h3. Expected Results
The organization field should contain the organization

h3. Actual Results
The Organization field is blank. See attached for screenshots.

h3. Workaround
Currently none.
fields.summary: Organisation field is blank when Printing

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms
* Affected sites will see two portal-only customers with the same email address in site admin under /admin/jira-service-desk/portal-only-customers
* Duplicated customers will be unable to log in or raise requests

h3. Sites affected
* Any site that performed an import between April 17th and May 25th, 2018 that contained portal-only customers in the import file, and had portal-only customers existing on the destination site of the import may be affected by this bug.

h3. Solution
* Deleting one of the duplicated users will allow the remaining user to log in again.
fields.summary: Jira import creates two JSD portal-only customers with the same email address

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Request is created in Service Desk, Organization Members only receive a notification that the request is created and must opt in to receive additional updates by accessing the Customer Portal and clicking on *Get notifications* and this not configurable depending on the organization.

_reference: [Managing Service Desk Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html#Managingservicedesknotifications-Howdifferentrolesreceivenotifications]_

h3. Suggested Solution
As different customer organization can have different requirements, create a configuration to choose which organization will receive notifications and which one won't receive.
 
h3. Workaround 
Organization Member must opt-in to receive additional notifications clicking on *Get notifications* on the request
fields.summary: Ability to choose send notification to some organizations

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Wiki Style renderer, mentioning an issue will show the status of the mentioned issue. When an issue number is mentioned in a comment/description, the status will show the actual status instead of the configured *Status name to show customer*. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure the comment is using Wiki Style renderer.
# Configure the *Status name to show customer* in the Request Type.
# Create a request and mention the request number in the comments. Transition the issue to the status configured in #2.

h3. Expected Results
Customer Notification will show the status name configured in *Status name to show customer*
h3. Actual Results
Customer Notification will show the actual status.
 
h3. Notes
The status will show correct in the portal.
The status will show the Workflow status in Jira when mentioned in comment/description field.

h3.Workaround
Change the renderer to Default Text. Take note that this will cause attachments to not be shown.
fields.summary: Customer Notification does not respect Status name to show customer configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk Admins would like for their Customers to be able to subscribe to their Confluence KBs for updates that they may make to their documentation
Even if the Customer has been converted to an Atlassian account Customer, unless they are licensed in the instance for Confluence, they are unable to Watch the Pages

h3. Suggested Solution
Include a Watch/Subscribe option in the Service Desk Portal that allows Customers to receive updates to KBs

h3. Why this is important
Service Desk Admins would like a way to share updates with their Customers through their Confluence KBs

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk Customers to Subscribe to Linked Confluence KBs for Updates

fields.description: As an admin, I would like to be able to configure the customer portal fields side by side instead of a list.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to configure the customer portal fields side by side

fields.description:
As per requested by customers, it would be good to have the ability to copy issue key + summary from issue view. With the changes on the interface, now if the user clicks and drags, the issue is drag, but the details are not selected to be copied.

It would also be good to have key + summary on the same line.

Thanks for your attention.
fields.summary: Allow users to copy key + summary from issue view

fields.description:
The customer proposed the following:
Request types could be independent from issue types. 
Basically, the necessity of linking a request type to an issue type upon it's creation (in the project settings) could be avoided.

Or, at least, there could be an option to change the issue type of a request type to any issue type, but without the need of having to create the request type with the same name multiple times.

Perhaps, the linked issue type could be a default one upon the request's creation, but after that, there could be the possibility of selecting any issue type independent of the current request type.
fields.summary: Have request types be independent from issue types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Previously in older Cloud version, the options is there. However, the options is removed. For existing automation , the options still remain, but not for new custom automation rule.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Service Desk project
# Navigate to "Project Settings" > "Automation"
# Click "Add Rule"
# Choose "Custom Role"
# Click "Next"
# Click "Add a trigger"
# Choose the following trigger: "A linked issue is transitioned"
# Click "Add"
# Click "Add an action"
# Choose the following action: "Add Comment"
# Click "Add"

h3. Expected Results
"Include the linked issue's details" options is at the bottom of the settings. Refer the screenshot below :-
 !automation.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The options is not there.
fields.summary: "Include the linked issue details" options is removed from "Add Comment" action for  "A linked issue is transitioned" automation event

fields.description:
If a cascading select field is set to required, only the first selection field is actually required The second field can be left selected. How do I make both fields required?

!image-2018-05-22-16-50-40-256.png!
fields.summary: How do I make the second field of a cascading select field mandatory?

fields.description:
Currently, if a request raised by customer is updated as a result of automation rule, it does not get updated in real time. For instance, if an automation rule auto-approves a request, approve / decline button are still presented, although approval has already been done.

At least message should be improved to let customer know that issue has been approved rather than saying *approval has been decided*.
fields.summary: Notify customer in real time on portal if request is updated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the available variables are limited. Admins would like to be able to select more variables to expand automation capability.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add more variables in automation. eg: Due Date
h3. Why this is important
This would allow admins to automate a lot more than what it is able to do currently.
fields.summary: Add more variables in automation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Automation to create issue fails when the rule is triggered by a portal only customer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule to Create Issue. Set the automation to run as user who triggered the rule.
# Logged in with a portal only customer, trigger the automation to allow issue creation.

h3. Expected Results
Automation creates an issue and the reporter will be set as the customer.
h3. Actual Results
Automation fails with an error _Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a Jira application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application._
 
h3. Notes
The automation will succeed and issue will be created if the rule is set to be triggered by the default user or by a licensed user.
The automation should allow the issue creation as the portal only customer has permissions to create an issue in the project.
fields.summary: Automation to create issue fails when automation is triggered by Portal only customer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some banners do not fit well in mobile view.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow configuring Customer Portal banner for mobile view
fields.summary: Allow configuring Customer Portal banner for mobile view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a customer transitions a ticket from the portal with the post function *clear field value* the resolution is cleared but is not recorded in the ticket History.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the post function *Clear Field Value* to a transition and expose it to the customer in the portal
 # Notice you can still set the customer configuration of what happens to the resolution when the customer transitions - not relevant, you can set it or not. It doesn't change anything.
 # As a customer, click on the transition in the portal
 # As an agent view the ticket within Jira, notice the resolution has been cleared but there is no record of that in the history

h3. Expected Results

A log is made in the History of the ticket showing that the customer made a transition and cleared the resolution
h3. Actual Results

Only the transition is recorded in the History
h3. Notes

This can make SLA reports inaccurate and is somewhat impossible to reliably view the history of the ticket
h3. Workaround

Replace the post function *Clear Field Value* with *Update Issue Field*
fields.summary: When a customer transitions a ticket from the portal with the post function *clear field value* the resolution is cleared but is not recorded in the ticket History.

fields.description:
We have a problem if our service agents are going to vacation or are ill.

If the agent is a lead or component lead, new issues are assigned to them. But they can't work currently, so someone else has to look into there account.

Another problem is, that the e-mail account of the agent is configured with "auto-reply" in they are not in the office. They are not only agents, they do also other work in the office, so it is iomportant to inform people, that they are not availble. But the auto-reply will also respond to the Jira service desk notification if a new ticket is raised. So the reported will see "your contact is currently not available" which is not what we want.

 

We need something like a "holiday replacement". That we can configure, that "Agent a" is currently in vacation and his replacment is "Agent b". For that timeframe, all notifications must also go to "Agent b".

 

Currently we have to reconfigure all leads if they leaf the office which is pretty annoying
fields.summary: Vacation of agents

fields.description:
Specifically, I would like to give users a list of resolved requests for them to close, rather than them appearing in the select of "Closed requests" status.

Further, I believe that using the same underlying query engine as the queues would give admins the ability to configure customer lists that match the workflow designed for the agents
fields.summary: As an admin I would like to define custom filters/listys for use in the support portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We need a way to create multiple tickets at the customer portal using the same value except for one specific field. i.e. some key data provided will be different but the user doesn't want to retype the data that remains the same over and over again each time.
h3. Suggested Solution
Parse out comma-separated values added in a text field, then use those separate values to created identical tickets but with each individual value in that target text field.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk create tickets at customer portal

fields.description:
Summary:

At the moment it is not possible to set an order in which Automation Rules are executed in JSD.
If you have many Automation rules, you would like to have them executed in a specific order.
fields.summary: It should be possible to arrange Automation Rules in a certain order

fields.description:
Hi there, 

Good day We are exploring on using JSD and have the following queries 

1) When a user raises a service request via JSD . Based on the selection on 'issue type' & 'cost center' -  can it be automated to map this service request to an existing Jira core project without human intervening?

2) Based on the selection of the issues type , how do we automate it to assign to multiple emails and waiting for someone to pickup the ticket and reassign it under his/her name ?

thanks
fields.summary: Need advise on jira service desk auto link to jira core project & group assignee

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no option to disable customer notification based on channel type. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to disable customer notification based on channel type , for example email, JIRA or API.

h3. Why this is important
GIve flexibility for admin to configure who should receive the notification.
fields.summary: As Admin, I would like to disable customer notification if issue created from email

fields.description:
Sending an email usually would include a company logo, but I don't see any way to attach an image.
Referencing an image from a public URL is not ideal and doesn't work for most email clients these days, looking unprofessional.

*Reporter*: Doug
*E-mail*: [mailto:doug.finnie@flowz.co.uk]
fields.summary: Company logos in notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Portal is showing blank when accessing via IE

h3. Customer Impact
* Customers unable to log new tickets/view the tickets

h3. Environment
* JSD
* IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open IE 11
# Access the global portal: https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/login?destination=portals

h3. Expected Results
Show login page

h3. Actual Results
Showing an empty page
!screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

*Application logs:*
!screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!
* {{SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method 'assign'}} is the constant error

h3. Notes
* Working fine on other browsers

h3.Workaround
* Use Chrome/Firefox to access the portal
fields.summary: Service Desk Customer Portal Not Working On IE

fields.description: Or I haven't found out?
fields.summary: No way to query ratings using JQL

fields.description:
The client cannot move between help desks 
He needs it all in one location
fields.summary: We need a way to connect multiple emails to the same help desk

fields.description:
I'm trying to use JIRA service desk as internal portal and manage issue.
 And i found gorgeous feature to our team that is Widget of portal.

I want to use the widget as internal portal and make not submit email 
 and use the login feature.

Please let me know whether it's possible or not 
 and if possible, how to set it.
fields.summary: Make Email field optional in widget of log-in free portal.

fields.description: Is there any plans to add the ability to modify the display columns on the grid. Particularly, we are looking for the issue date.
fields.summary: add issue date to help center requests page

fields.description:
We would like to be able to specify a separate notification template for different resolutions, either through the customer notification settings, or via automation conditions.

Example use case: If a travel request has been completed successfully, we would like to send out a notification that says "Your trip has been booked. Please prepare for your upcoming trip by following these steps....". If the issue was declined or the ticket resolved as "won't fix" (for example) we would want something like "This issue has been closed. Please contact travel team if you have any questions."
fields.summary: Allow different Service Desk Customer notification depending on Resolution

fields.description:
Summary

When you go to the [Administering JIRA Cloud applications|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5862] page there is a link for the New JIRA experience guide (https://confluence.stg.internal.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/introducing-your-new-jira-experience), but if you click on it, it will take you to a 404 error page please see the screenshots below:
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-11 at 14.30.40.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-05-11 at 16.02.03.png|thumbnail! 

Steps to Reproduce
Navigate to https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/administering-jira-cloud-applications-884344454.html/ and click on the "New JIRA experience guide" link.
fields.summary: Error 404 when clicking in the "New JIRA experience guide" link

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When the customer who reported the request is deleted, the information displayed in the reporter field will be the global ID + [X] (Inactive):
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-11 at 10.51.47.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a portal customer, create a request via the portal;
 # Delete the portal customer used to create the request;
 # Check the reporter in the issue view.



h3. Expected Results
The reporter should be displayed as *Full name* + [X] (Inactive) or *E-mail address* + [X] (Inactive).

h3. Actual Results
the reporter is displayed as *Global ID* + [X] (Inactive).

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Reporter information displays the global ID when the customer is deleted

fields.description: For it's crucial, that a customer is only visibile within the corresponding project. As far as I can see, a customer is added to a global list and is visible for every agent from any project. Please add a feature, that agents can only see customers within the projects they can access.
fields.summary: Visibility of customers between different projects
Adding a participant to an issue does NOT add them to the Watch list and they DON'T receive issue updates

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At times, customers would like to create a personal requests anonymously so that the request would not be tied to them. However, it is not possible at the moment as although customers log into the portal anonymously, they still need to key in an email address.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customers to create their request as an anonymous user.
fields.summary: Allow to anonymize reporter in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Emails sent to an IMAP custom Service Desk inbox with attachments bigger than 2Mb will not create a ticket in their JSD project. The email is read in the mailbox though but there is no record of JSD ever processing it. The issue is reproducible by the customer as the email is currently sitting in their inbox as read, and has been marked as unread several times. The email gets then marked as read with no success in creating the ticket in JSD.

This issue may also present as delays in all of JSD’s custom mailbox pulling processes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup custom secure IMAP mail server
 # Receive an email with attachment of around 2Mb or larger
 # Notice the email will be read, but no record is logged in Jira

NOTE: This could not be reproduced in our Atlassian test environment.
h3. Expected Results
 # Email is set with attachment
 # Ticket is created and a log created in Jira

h3. Actual Results

Email is marked as read but JSD ticket does not get generated and the following stack trace is found in the logs:
{code:java}
com.sun.mail.util.FolderClosedIOException
	at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPInputStream.forceCheckExpunged(IMAPInputStream.java:107)
	at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPInputStream.fill(IMAPInputStream.java:158)
	at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPInputStream.read(IMAPInputStream.java:218)
	at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPInputStream.read(IMAPInputStream.java:244)
	at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPMessage.writeTo(IMAPMessage.java:849)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.util.MimeMessageBase64ChunkStream.fullyLoadMessageToMemory(MimeMessageBase64ChunkStream.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.util.MimeMessageBase64ChunkStream.<init>(MimeMessageBase64ChunkStream.java:22)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.MailItemStore.createMailItemChunk(MailItemStore.java:237)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.MailItemStore.lambda$null$2(MailItemStore.java:212)
	at io.atlassian.fugue.Option.map(Option.java:259)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.MailItemStore.lambda$createMailItem$3(MailItemStore.java:210)
	at com.atlassian.pocketknife.internal.querydsl.DatabaseAccessorImpl.lambda$execute$0(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.rdbms.DefaultTransactionalExecutor.executeInternal(DefaultTransactionalExecutor.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.rdbms.DefaultTransactionalExecutor$1.execute(DefaultTransactionalExecutor.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.sal.rdbms.JiraHostConnectionAccessor.lambda$borrowConnectionAndExecute$0(JiraHostConnectionAccessor.java:62)
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.DatabaseAccessorImpl.executeQuery(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.sal.rdbms.JiraHostConnectionAccessor.borrowConnectionAndExecute(JiraHostConnectionAccessor.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.sal.rdbms.JiraHostConnectionAccessor.execute(JiraHostConnectionAccessor.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.rdbms.DefaultTransactionalExecutor.execute(DefaultTransactionalExecutor.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.pocketknife.internal.querydsl.SalTransactionalExecutor.execute(SalTransactionalExecutor.java:21)
	at com.atlassian.pocketknife.internal.querydsl.DatabaseAccessorImpl.execute(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.pocketknife.internal.querydsl.DatabaseAccessorImpl.runInTransaction(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.querydsl.QueryDslHelper.runInTransaction(QueryDslHelper.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.MailItemStore.createMailItem(MailItemStore.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.MailItemManager.createMailItemFromMessage(MailItemManager.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.MailPullerWorker.persistMailMessage(MailPullerWorker.java:256)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.MailPullerWorker.pullEmailForConnection(MailPullerWorker.java:167)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.MailPullerWorker.handlePullFromNormalMailConnection(MailPullerWorker.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.MailPullerWorker.handlePullFromConnection(MailPullerWorker.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.MailPullerWorker.pullEmailsForChannel(MailPullerWorker.java:92)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.MailPullerWorker.pullMailFromAllValidChannels(MailPullerWorker.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.MailPullerService.run(MailPullerService.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.MailPullerExecutor.run(MailPullerExecutor.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.AbstractMailExecutor.execute(AbstractMailExecutor.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.MailJobRunner.runJob(MailJobRunner.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.cronman.service.ModeAwareJobWrapper.runJob(ModeAwareJobWrapper.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:195)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:168)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchJob(JobLauncher.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:129)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.cronman.service.ScheduledJobMessageRunner.launch(ScheduledJobMessageRunner.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.cronman.service.ScheduledJobMessageRunner.lambda$processMessage$0(ScheduledJobMessageRunner.java:60)
	at java.util.Optional.ifPresent(Optional.java:159)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.cronman.service.ScheduledJobMessageRunner.processMessage(ScheduledJobMessageRunner.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.core.NestedMessageConsumer.consume(NestedMessageConsumer.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.sqs.SQSMessageConsumer.processReceiveMessageResult(SQSMessageConsumer.java:171)
	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.sqs.SQSMessageConsumer.run(SQSMessageConsumer.java:112)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}
On that search, a warning message {{Could not acquire the CLUSTER_LOCK therefore the job will not be executed}} is shown in the logs 6 seconds before the error message triggers. This always happens for all the emails that failed to be processed.
h3. Notes
 * By looking at the connectivity logs for that inbox, we can see several of [AUTHENTICATIONFAILED] Invalid credentials (Failure) errors in the last month. Related bug JSDCLOUD-5988: Connectivity log displays "AUTHENTICATE failed" errors

 * Purged the inbox and cleared all existing emails leaving only the affected email as unread
 * Forward the email directly to the default Jira inbox, a ticket was created

h3. Workaround

Forward mail to the default mail address for the Service Desk project

* Be aware of the need to pass SPF checks for forwarding set-up
* Ensure that the forwarding method doesn’t add an “Auto-Submitted” header
fields.summary: Emails with Large Size Attachments Fail To Generate Ticket in IMAP Mailbox

fields.description:
# Execution Status (ES %) = Sum of execution hours/ Sum of planned hours  * 100  (in procent to be visible how much from what we planned was done)
 # Remaining time (RT- hours) = 8 x no of days until the delivery x no of persons assigned for this role  (how much time do we have available until the release date)
 # Slippage Time (planed vs actual %)
 # Past load (PL):  no of hours executed in a certain time frame / no of hours that can be planned in that time frame * 100 ( to be able to find out the load of this person in a certain time frame)
fields.summary: I need suggestions regarding this topics

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to choose the recipients of comments in Jira Service Desk tickets. There are only two options, *Share with customer* and *Comment internally*. Therefore there's no way to control the recipients of comments unless you add them as participants in the ticket.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way to choose more recipients to receive the notification from comments on tickets.
h3. Why this is important

This can provide more flexibility in notifying certain users about a ticket without the need of adding them as participants in the request.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to control the recipients of comments on service desk tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Report SLA Goals show 'no issues'

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Service Desk Project
# Create an Issue
# Resolve the issue
# Access the default report SLA Goals

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be shown on the report Success Rate cell.

h3. Actual Results
Under Success Rate shows: *No issues*
fields.summary: Report SLA Goals show 'no issues'

fields.description:
*Summary*

If you view the customer portal ticket creation fields in the mobile browser, the tooltip can be out of position which doesn't allow you to read the tooltip at all or will block the field vision, so when you type you can't see what you are typing in the field because the tooltip is blocking it and you can't disable it as well, as it pops up while typing. 

 

*Environment*

Mobile Browser(iOS and Android) - Google Chrome, Opera, tested so far, likely more browsers are affected.

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Go to a customer portal and choose any request types to create an issue
 # Check any Request Type with default options such as Summary or Description which comes with a tooltip to suggest the written content
 # Clicking on the field will obstruct your view with the tooltip popping out or if you click on the tooltip, it will show off-screen or out of position. 

 

*Sample Screenshot*

!1.jpeg|width=321,height=463!

!2.jpeg|width=321,height=513!

!3.jpeg|width=315,height=448!

 

*Expected Results*

Able to view the tooltip when necessary and in the correct position, able to click the tooltip so that it doesn't block field of view when not needed. 

*Actual Results*

The tool-tip blocks the view when the field is clicked on and highlighted automatically and sometimes the tool-tip shows of-screen, this also is influence on how much text is in the tool-tip.
fields.summary: Tooltip Is Positioned Out of Focus or Blocking the Text Field In Mobile Browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing the Service Desk project customers page and the Jira user profile preferred language is not _Automatically detect browser setting,_ it results in long loading times.
h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your user Jira profile via [https://<CloudSiteURL>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa|https://farfetch.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa] and in the *Preferences* section, set your *Language* to any language other than _Automatically detect browser setting_.
 # Access the Service Desk customers page via [https://<CloudSiteURL>.atlassian.net/projects/<projectID>/customers|https://xyz.atlassian.net/projects/PROJECTID/customers].
 # The same behaviour is reproducible when _Automatically detect browser setting_ was selected, and the browser language is not of the supported ones by Jira.

h3. Expected Results

Performance is not degraded and customers page loads in few seconds.
h3. Actual Results 

Performance is degraded, and loading times are high.
h3. Workaround
 # Access your Jira profile via [https://<CloudSiteURL>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa|https://farfetch.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa] and in the *Preferences* section, set your *Language* to *Automatically detect browser setting*.
 # Then, check your browser configuration, and make sure that the preferred language is one of the supported in Jira.
fields.summary: Project customers page takes long time to load

fields.description: Our customers would like to be able to see which agent their ticket is assigned to and to also be able to close tickets that are no longer relevant.
fields.summary: Allow the Customer to see the Agent that is working on their ticket and to resolve tickets

fields.description:
Remove System Dashboard from lateral menu. 
User wants the 'System Dashboard' to go away. He has the two dashboards that he wants to view, and he doesn't want to see this system one. 
There was two (2) instances of the same system dashboard, then when he unfavourited it, one of them went away.
fields.summary: Remove System Dashboard from lateral menu

fields.description:
h3.Summary

It is not possible to choose a project specific custom field from the basic JQL field searcher when constructing a JSD automation rule condition. This is because you cannot set the project clause in the condition for automation condition JQL. This only affects the basic JQL mode (not advance mode).

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

h3.Steps to Replicate

# Create a custom field in JIRA Service Desk project.
# Go to the project in step 1 and create an automation rule. 
# For its condition, specify a JQL query via basic mode. Try searching for the field created in step 1.

h3.Expected Results

Because the automation is within the project itself, it should not be required to specify the project in order to use any fields that belongs to the project. Users should be able to pick any fields of the project. 

h3.Current Result

It is not possible to select any custom fields that belongs to the same project . 

h3.Workaround

Use advance JQL mode to specify the fields as a workaround. You cannot choose the fields from the basic mode but you can still specify them in advance mode.
fields.summary: Basic JQL field searcher for automation rules prevents project specific fields from being used

fields.description:
As per requested by the customer, it would make Jira SD Cloud much easier to use if the filters were automatically updated after changing an Organisation name.

With the current behaviour, users need to update, manually, all filters when the organisation name changes. The same happens when project name changes.
fields.summary: Change associated filter queries after renaming organisation

fields.description: Since a new layout has been implemented, https://www.atlassian.com/blog/archives/new-issue-status-jira-adg-lozenge, I kindly suggest the removal of the option that allows users to change the icon of the statuses of the issues.
fields.summary: Hide option to change status icons

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Portal only users can only be exported from the User Management. As it is possible to add Jira users as customers to a project or to an organization, these users would not appear in the portal-only-customers export list.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to be able to export the customers with information of them belonging to which organization for each project.
h3. Why this is important
For reporting purposes.
fields.summary: Ability to export users and organization per projects

fields.description:
Hi,

my account is cloud domain account [https://hatari.atlassian.net/]

I'm using Jira Helpdesk and Confluence and I want to migrate to local server which need both license key. I can't find both of it. Could you please tell me where is it?

By the way, I can't find instruction how to using backup (.zip) which I backup on cloud account to restore on my local server.

Thank you.

Panya
fields.summary: Where is my license key for my local server?

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to change email address for Jira Service Desk project from mailbox A to mailbox B and then back to mailbox A, the following error is shown:
{code}
Email address you entered is currently used by another service desk
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a JSD project and enable Email requests:
https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/<Project_Key>/email-settings

2. Change email address and save it
3. Change email address back to initial one

h3. Expected Results

Email should be successfully changed

h3. Actual Results

Even though mailbox A is not actually used by any project, the following error is shown:
{code}
Email address you entered is currently used by another service desk
{code}

h3. Workaround 

You will need to contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] and ask for the fix.
fields.summary: Receiving error: "Email address you entered is currently used by another service desk", however email doesn't exist in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Customers are located in different timezones, and often the timestamps shown in the customer portal is not correct

h3. Suggested Solution
* Leverage location services to automatically set the timezone on the JSD customer profile

h3. Why this is important
* At times it could be awkward to ask the JSD customer to make changes to the support portal profile as it is something that customers might not be comfortable doing
 
h3. Workaround 
* Ask the JSD customer log into the portal and manually change the timezone settings at https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/profile#
fields.summary: Automatically update customer timezone settings

fields.description: If a customer opens an issue to JSD portal through e-mail and its email includes Text Formatting Notations, Jira will user them on the issue description. This can lead to issues, i.e. a customer sends an e-mail and his signature has "**********" to separate his email body form signature, then Jira interprets the message as a long and empty bullet list.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to prevent Jira from interpreting customer e-mail characters as Text Formatting Notations

fields.description: As per requested by customers, I kindly suggest that Jira would allow Jira Admin users to remove SLA fields from issues.
fields.summary: Allow Jira Admin users to remove SLA fields from issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JSD requests created via Widget could fail if the project has required or custom fields that are added or removed after the widget is loaded.

Request submitter still see the confirmation message on the website since the validation of the request is performed asynchronously.
h3. Steps to reproduce

 
 # Configuring and enabling a widget for your project
 # Add a field to your issue type
 # Load the widget in one browser
 # Remove the field from the issue type
 # Submit the widget with the old form

h3. Expected

The request is created
h3. Actual

Request creation failed
fields.summary: Widget request creation sometime fails if require fields change

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If a portal customer attaches a file to the request, and the file has an exclamation point in it's name, the file won't be displayed in the portal view.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Add an attachment to the request (via the portal);
 # Make sure that the file has an exclamation point (*!*) in the name;
 # See that it won't be possible to view it from the portal view;
 # Access the issue from the Jira view (internal), and see that the attachment is correctly displayed.


h3. Expected Results

The attachment should be displayed as it is in the issue view (internally):
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-30 at 4.23.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

There is an error message displayed instead of the file:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-30 at 4.21.50 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

If the file name has no exclamation point, it will be displayed correctly.
fields.summary: File with exclamation point in the name won't render in the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, "Update Linked issue" automation only will trigger when status changed in linked issue. 
It will be better if it trigger when comment added too.
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option for "Update Linked issue" to include *Status Changed* , *Comment added* and *Field update*

h3. Why this is important
The agents will get alert in existing ticket when comment added in the linked issue.
fields.summary: Enhancement "Update Linked Issue" automation to trigger when comment added/field update in linked issue
